reporting-org.narrative: AICS - Italian Agency for Cooperation and Development

title.narrative: Strengthening the Resilience of Crisis-Affected Households through multisectoral support to PwD Women and Youth Empowerment in Deir Ezzor Governorate

description.narrative: L’Intervento proposto mira a sostenere la resilienza dei siriani vulnerabili con un'assistenza multisettoriale in un'area geografica fortemente colpita dal conflitto. Il programma mira a rafforzare la resilienza della popolazione colpita per favorire la ripresa economica, ridurre gli sfollamenti e promuovere la reintegrazione sostenibile dei rimpatriati.

The proposed project aims to support resilience of vulnerable Syrian women and men with a multisectoral assistance focus on a geographical area heavily impacted by the conflict. Building the resilience of affected population is a contribution to fostering recovery, reducing the driving factors for displacement and promoting sustainable re-integration of returnees.

tag.narrative: Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls
By 2030, end hunger and ensure access by all people, in particular the poor and people in vulnerable situations, including infants, to safe, nutritious and sufficient food all year round
By 2030, eradicate extreme poverty for all people everywhere, currently measured as people living on less than $1.25 a day
End all forms of discrimination against all women and girls everywhere
End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture
End poverty in all its forms everywhere

Promote a universal, rules-based, open, non-discriminatory and equitable multilateral trading system under the World Trade Organization, including through the conclusion of negotiations under its Doha Development Agenda
Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all
Strengthen the means of implementation and revitalize the global partnership for sustainable development
Sustain per capita economic growth in accordance with national circumstances and, in particular, at least 7 per cent gross domestic product growth per annum in the least developed countries
